Posts.Content: Andrea07 wrote: I'm new here and scared.  I'm a 40 year old mom of two little boys (ages 6 and 3) and was diagnosed with IDC in October.  It is a 1.8cm tumor and is her2 + and Er+ with one node affected........that's pretty much all I know.  My onc and surgeon have started me on chemo first and then surgery since my mom had ovarian cancer and I might carry the gene.  If I do carry the gene,  I will have to have a double masectomy and ovaries removed.  My surgeon didn't want to do a lumpectomy now and then a masectomy later so we went this route.  My genetic testing isn't until January and it takes 4 weeks to get the results, so I will halfway done with chemo by then.  I am on taxotere, carboplatin, and herceptin every three weeks.  I will continue herceptin for a year.  I have had one treatment so far and have another this week.  My problem is that everything that I'm reading makes me feel like I'm doomed since I'm Her2+.    All that you read is how aggressive it is and recurence factors and so forth, that I'm already worried about reccurence and I haven't even finished this battle so far.  My doctor at Magee Hospital in Pittsburgh is VERY respected and known and I have faith in him, but I can't shake this overwhelming sense of looming death sentence.  He says that my prognosis is good......but that doesn't make me feel that great and I'm not sure why.   I believe that I'm just scared beyond belief. Please, please help me get some GOOD stories about girls who have walked this same path.  I really need something positive to hold onto so that I don't let fear take over.   How do you keep your focus on the good and not the "ugly".  Any advice would really be appreciated by this nervous mom.  I want to be here to see these guys turn into men.....and it makes me so sad to worry that I might not.  Thank you so much.
